Yes, I completely agree with you. One of the most remarkable qualities of Verdi's music is its ability to be both grand and intimate at the same time. Whether he was composing an aria or a chorus, his music always had a powerful emotional impact on the listener. Verdi's ability to craft complex and sophisticated music was rooted in his mastery of musical form and his deep understanding of the human condition.

Through his music, Verdi was able to create moments of both grandeur and intimacy, often in the same opera. His operas are known for their sweeping melodies and powerful choral arrangements, but they also contain moments of quiet reflection and poignant solos. These seemingly contradictory elements blend together perfectly in Verdi's music, creating a sense of dramatic tension that keeps the listener engaged throughout.

Overall, Verdi's ability to create music that can be both grand and intimate at the same time is just one of the many reasons why his works remain so beloved and relevant today.
